attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: My oppinion is i think that teenagers should have the right to an education they choose as my son is at the age of 15 and has had the ambition to be a hairdresser and when he approched the head of the school to transfer they replied with no i dont think they have the right to stop him wanting to go to collage as there is nothing in his school witch helps him in this course but i dont understand why they said no as the course is open to student 14-19 years of age so i have made this petition to make it a right that a student has the right to transfer to collage if he/she wishes

rejection.details:
It is not possible to understand what you mean by asking the Prime Minister to "alternate education". Your title should be more clear.
The extra detail contains information on a personal issue which is not appropriate for pursuit through the e-petitions system.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
